description: The Lumminary API allows third-party developers to securely interact with Lumminary customers and access their genetic data.
tldr: The Lumminary API provides a secure and scalable platform for third-party developers to integrate with Lumminary customers. It enables access to genetic data, facilitating the development of services and products that utilize genetic information. All communications are encrypted via SSL, ensuring data privacy and security for customer authorizations and genetic datasets.

description: The Snyk API offers programmatic integration for Business and Enterprise plan customers to test packages for security issues.
tldr: The Snyk API provides a programmatic interface for customers on Business and Enterprise plans to test packages for security vulnerabilities. While it can infer dependency versions, integrating Snyk via the CLI or into your development workflow offers more precise results by testing actual deployed code or monitoring pull requests. This API serves as a viable alternative when other integration methods are not feasible or practical for your specific use case.

description: The Portfolio Optimizer API analyzes and optimizes investment portfolios using modern portfolio theory algorithms.
tldr: The Portfolio Optimizer API provides tools to analyze and optimize investment portfolios. It leverages modern portfolio theory algorithms, including mean-variance and Value at Risk (VaR), to help users make informed investment decisions. This REST-based API uses JSON for data exchange and standard HTTP verbs for interaction. It ensures data security with 256-bit HTTPS encryption, does not utilize cookies or personal data, and requires an API key for access to higher usage limits.

description: The Shorten.REST API allows programmatic creation of short URLs (aliases) that redirect based on location and device.
tldr: The Shorten.REST API facilitates the programmatic generation of short URLs, referred to as aliases, for longer destination URLs. These aliases offer advanced redirection capabilities, allowing users to be directed to different destinations based on their geographical location (country) and their device's operating system. Users have the flexibility to either integrate their own branded domains for these short URLs or utilize the default domain provided by Shorten.REST for their URL shortening needs.

description: Taxrates.io is a global tax rate service that automates the management of monitoring tax rate changes in 181 countries.
tldr: Taxrates.io provides a global tax rate service, automating the monitoring of tax rate changes across 181 countries. It tracks over 14,000 US sales tax, VAT, and GST rates, delivering real-time updates through its API to ensure users always have the most current tax information. The service also offers product-level tax rates for specific product codes, which is particularly useful for items that are exempt or taxed at reduced rates in various jurisdictions.

description: The Trakt API provides access to a vast database of TV show and movie information for integration into applications.
tldr: The Trakt API enables developers to integrate Trakt's comprehensive TV show and movie data into their applications and websites. It offers a range of operations, including retrieving information and managing user content, primarily through RESTful API calls that utilize JSON data. To begin using the API, developers are required to create an API application and comply with specific authentication and header protocols.

description: The Velo Payments API enables payors to manage payments to payees, supporting authentication, payee collections, balance queries, funding, and payment issuance.
tldr: The Velo Payments API provides a comprehensive solution for payors to manage their payment processes. It allows for secure authentication, maintenance of payee collections, querying account balances, funding accounts, and issuing payments to various payees. This REST-based API utilizes JSON for all request and response payloads, ensuring straightforward data exchange, and is secured using the industry-standard OAuth 2.0 protocol for robust access control.

description: The GoDaddy Abuse API simplifies and standardizes the process of reporting abuse, requiring all submissions through its portal.
tldr: The GoDaddy Abuse API streamlines abuse reporting, mandating that all reports be submitted via the API portal instead of email for specific abuse types. Accurate categorization of abuse is essential; reports with incorrect categories or more than five URLs for one domain will be deprioritized or flagged as false positives. A false positive rate exceeding 40% may result in future submissions being deprioritized.

description: The Benefits Intake API allows authorized third-party systems to digitally submit VA benefits claim documents to the Veterans Benefits Administration.
tldr: The Benefits Intake API facilitates the digital submission of VA benefits claim documents by authorized third-party systems, such as Veteran Service Organizations and agencies. It integrates directly with the Veterans Benefits Administration's claims intake process, supporting various claim types including Compensation, Education, and Veteran Readiness & Employment. This API also offers submission status updates, which helps to streamline the overall process and removes the necessity for manual status checks.

description: The Truora Check API performs comprehensive background checks on individuals, vehicles, and companies in LATAM.
tldr: The Truora Check API facilitates comprehensive background checks across the LATAM region. It verifies national IDs, vehicle documents, and tax IDs by cross-referencing multiple public and legal databases. The API delivers detailed information covering personal identity, criminal records, driving records, business status, and media reports, enabling thorough due diligence for various purposes.

description: The Text Analytics & Sentiment Analysis API, version 3.4, processes text data and integrates via SDKs or direct methods.
tldr: The Text Analytics & Sentiment Analysis API, version 3.4, provides various methods for processing text data. It supports integration directly into applications or through an SDK. This API is also leveraged by Excel Add-Ins and Google Sheets Add-ons, expanding its utility across different platforms. Users can conveniently test the API methods directly from the documentation page by configuring an API key for pre-authentication.

description: The Griffin API is a RESTful API that uses resource-oriented URLs and accepts/returns JSON-encoded bodies.
tldr: The Griffin API is a RESTful API that utilizes resource-oriented URLs for programmatic navigation. It accepts JSON-encoded request bodies and returns JSON-encoded responses, adhering to standard HTTP verbs and codes. While generally following REST principles, it deviates for tighter access controls where beneficial. The API supports pagination, filtering, and sorting for list APIs, with related resource URLs embedded within response bodies.

description: The Rumble API, now deprecated, was a network discovery tool that has since transitioned to runZero.
tldr: The Rumble API, version 2.15.0, is a deprecated network discovery tool. It is no longer updated, and its functionalities have been superseded by runZero. Users seeking current features and support should consult the runZero API documentation instead of this frozen version.

description: The Journy.io API offers frontend and backend solutions for sending user and account data, integrating with existing tech stacks.
tldr: The Journy.io API provides comprehensive frontend and backend functionalities for transmitting data related to users and accounts, ensuring smooth integration with diverse tech stacks. It enables the tracking of user interactions, account activities, and various events, offering the flexibility to link these events to individual users, accounts, or both. Additionally, the API supports the inclusion of supplementary details as metadata, facilitating the creation of robust computed properties for advanced analytics and insights.

description: PhantAuth is an API that generates random users and acts as an OpenID Connect Provider for testing.
tldr: PhantAuth is an API designed to simplify testing for applications that utilize OpenID Connect authentication. It functions as both a random user generator and a fully compliant OpenID Connect Provider. This allows developers to easily obtain temporary, randomly generated user accounts for testing authentication flows. The API supports various OpenID Connect flows and can be integrated directly into applications or used with authentication services such as Auth0.

description: Probely is a web vulnerability scanning suite for agile teams, offering continuous scanning of web applications.
tldr: Probely provides a web vulnerability scanning suite designed for agile teams, focusing on continuous scanning of web applications. It facilitates efficient management of vulnerability lifecycles through its web interface API. Users authenticate by creating API keys, which are then used in the authorization header for all requests to manage targets and initiate scans.

description: This API provides comprehensive data on vendors within the OASIS and OASIS Small Business contracting vehicles.
tldr: The Discovery Market Research API offers detailed information about vendors participating in the OASIS and OASIS Small Business contracting programs. It includes crucial data points like past contracting history, eligibility for new awards, and specific small business designations. Access to this API requires an API key, which can be acquired from api.data.gov and must be submitted with every request to authenticate and authorize access to the vendor data.

description: The Ideal Postcodes API offers address lookup and validation services, supporting both HTTPS and HTTP with IPv4 and IPv6.
tldr: The Ideal Postcodes API provides robust address lookup and validation capabilities. It supports both secure HTTPS and plain HTTP connections, accommodating both IPv4 and IPv6 network protocols. The API uses standard HTTP status codes to clearly indicate the outcome of requests and enforces a rate limit of 30 requests per second per IP address to ensure fair usage. Authentication is straightforward, primarily requiring an API key passed either in the query string or as an HTTP header. The API is also versioned using a simple URL prefix, which helps maintain backward compatibility for integrations.

description: The Enode API simplifies smart charging application development by abstracting vehicle data and commands across manufacturers.
tldr: The Enode API offers a unified interface for interacting with various electric vehicle manufacturers, streamlining the creation of smart charging applications. It provides an abstraction layer for vehicle data and commands, allowing developers to focus on application logic rather than manufacturer-specific integrations. The API utilizes a RESTful architecture and secures access through OAuth2, requiring users to register and obtain credentials for production use.

description: The BulkSMS JSON REST API facilitates the submission and reception of BulkSMS messages and manages account information.
tldr: The BulkSMS JSON REST API enables users to send and receive BulkSMS messages, providing tools for efficient message management. It also allows access to historical messages and account profile details. The API requires requests and delivers responses in JSON format, adhering to ISO-8601 date formatting standards.

description: The DigitalOcean API offers a programmatic interface for managing cloud resources like Droplets using standard HTTP requests.
tldr: The DigitalOcean API provides a comprehensive programmatic interface for managing Droplets and other resources within the DigitalOcean cloud. It allows users to automate complex actions by offering all the functionality available in the DigitalOcean control panel. The API supports standard HTTP methods such as GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, and PATCH for various operations, with all responses returned as JSON objects.

description: Access comprehensive Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition data programmatically, including character abilities, skills, equipment, and spells.
tldr: The D&D 5th Edition API offers extensive data for Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition, enabling developers to programmatically retrieve game resources. It provides a broad spectrum of information, covering everything from character abilities and skills to various equipment and spells. This facilitates the development of diverse tools and applications for D&D enthusiasts. The API is openly accessible and does not require any authentication for data retrieval.

description: The Postman API offers programmatic access to data within a Postman account, requiring an API Key for authentication.
tldr: The Postman API allows users to programmatically interact with their Postman account data. To use the API, a valid API Key is essential for authentication, which can be generated and retrieved from the integrations dashboard within the Postman platform. All interactions with the API must be conducted over a secure HTTPS connection. Responses from the API are consistently formatted in JSON, and standard HTTP status codes are utilized to clearly indicate the success or failure of each API request.

description: The Influx OSS API Service offers a comprehensive set of endpoints for interacting with InfluxDB, an open-source time series database.
tldr: The Influx OSS API Service provides a robust interface for managing and interacting with InfluxDB, an open-source time series database. It enables users to perform various operations, including data manipulation, query execution, and configuration management. This API is crucial for developers who are building applications that rely on InfluxDB for efficient data storage, retrieval, and analysis, offering full control over their time series data infrastructure.

description: The Linode API enables programmatic management of Linode products and services for developers and system administrators.
tldr: The Linode API provides a programmatic interface for managing Linode products and services, catering to application developers and system administrators. It uses standard HTTP requests and returns data in JSON format, adhering to an OpenAPI Specification. Authentication is primarily handled through Personal Access Tokens or OAuth for endpoints that affect user accounts, though some endpoints are publicly accessible without authentication.

description: The logoraisr API offers a comprehensive reference for integrating its services into your applications.
tldr: The logoraisr API provides a complete guide for developers to integrate its services into their applications. It includes an OpenAPI specification, which simplifies the integration process and speeds up development. Users can directly download the OpenAPI JSON file, making it easy to access and implement the API's functionalities.

description: The Big Red Cloud API offers programmatic access to Big Red Cloud data, featuring Swagger for documentation.
tldr: The Big Red Cloud API provides programmatic access to Big Red Cloud data, enabling developers to integrate and manage their accounting information. It leverages Swagger for automatically generated documentation, allowing users to interact directly with the API on the documentation page. To begin using the API, an API Key is required, which can be entered directly on the page and is conveniently stored in local browser storage for future use.

description: NOWPayments API offers a non-custodial cryptocurrency payment processing platform for e-commerce.
tldr: The NOWPayments API provides a non-custodial cryptocurrency payment processing platform, enabling users to accept payments in various cryptocurrencies. It facilitates instant conversion of received crypto into a chosen coin and direct transfer to the user's wallet. The API includes functionalities for checking service availability, retrieving a list of supported currencies, determining minimum payment amounts, and creating new payment requests, thereby streamlining cryptocurrency transactions for e-commerce applications.

description: Pims provides a private API for third-party software, editors, and partners to access core customer data.
tldr: The Pims API offers private access to essential customer data, including events, ticket counts, and promotions, for third-party software, editors, and partners. It secures access using basic authentication, with credentials linked to specific customer domains. Responses are delivered in JSON format, adhering to the HAL specification, and error handling follows the Problem Details for HTTP APIs standard. API versioning is managed through URL paths, and all collection responses are paginated for efficient data retrieval.

description: OpenFinTech.io provides a standardized open database for the FinTech industry, including geolocation, organizations, currencies, banks, and payment providers.
tldr: OpenFinTech.io offers an open database with standardized primary data relevant to the FinTech industry. It encompasses a wide range of information, such as geolocation details, organizations, various currency types (national, digital, virtual, crypto), banks, digital exchangers, payment providers, and diverse payment methods. The API's core function is to streamline communication among cross-integrated micro-services by establishing standardized entity identifiers, thereby facilitating efficient information exchange within the FinTech ecosystem.

description: The Paylocity API is a RESTful web service using HTTP verbs and OAuth 2.0 for authorization, supporting JSON payloads.
tldr: The Paylocity API is a RESTful web service that utilizes standard HTTP verbs and OAuth 2.0 for secure authorization. It exclusively supports JSON for both request and response payloads, ensuring consistent data exchange. Paylocity provides two API versions, v1 and v2, with v2 being the primary focus for all new feature development and enhancements. Clients are issued secure credentials, including a client ID, a secret, and a public key for data encryption, with the secret requiring annual renewal for security purposes.

description: The Rebilly API is an HTTP-based, RESTful API that uses predictable resource URLs and returns HTTP response codes for error indication.
tldr: The Rebilly API is an HTTP-based, RESTful API that utilizes predictable resource URLs and provides HTTP response codes for error indication. It accepts and returns JSON in the HTTP body, facilitating integration with any HTTP/REST library or Rebilly's provided SDKs (PHP and Javascript). This API supports all actions available within the Rebilly application, enabling comprehensive workflow automation. It offers various authentication methods, including secret keys, publishable keys, and JSON Web Tokens, to secure access and operations.

description: Rev.ai provides a RESTful API for asynchronous speech-to-text recognition, offering high-quality transcription services.
tldr: The Rev.ai API allows developers to submit audio files for transcription and retrieve the resulting transcripts in JSON or plain text formats. It supports file submission through direct download URLs or by uploading local files, and includes options for webhooks to notify users upon job completion. This API is designed for asynchronous processing, ensuring efficient handling of transcription tasks.

description: The setlist.fm API provides access to setlist data for building websites and applications.
tldr: The setlist.fm API offers comprehensive access to setlist data, enabling developers to build applications that utilize information about musical performances. It provides methods to retrieve detailed setlists, including associated artists, cities, countries, and venues. The API supports both XML and JSON content types for data exchange and allows for internationalization of city and country names through the use of the Accept-Language header, catering to a global audience.

description: The Rudder API provides a RESTful interface for managing configurations, nodes, and other system aspects programmatically.
tldr: The Rudder API offers a RESTful interface for programmatic interaction with Rudder, enabling users to manage configurations, nodes, and various system aspects. It incorporates versioning, with each new feature release assigned an integer version number to maintain backward compatibility. Users have the flexibility to specify the desired API version either through the URL path or by utilizing the 'X-API-Version' HTTP header in their requests.

description: The CIS Automotive API provides authenticated access to automotive data using JSON Web Tokens (JWT).
tldr: The CIS Automotive API offers access to a wide range of automotive data. Users must authenticate by obtaining a JSON Web Token (JWT) using their CIS Automotive API Keys. This JWT is then required for all subsequent API endpoint calls to ensure secure access. The API supports both HTTP GET and POST methods across its various endpoints, which are organized with tags that may correspond to different access plans or data categories.

description: SimplyRETS provides real estate data, enabling developers and agents to build applications with live MLS data access.
tldr: The SimplyRETS API offers real estate data, allowing developers and agents to create applications. It provides access to live MLS data, which necessitates RETS credentials from your MLS to set up an application. The API secures access using Basic Authentication and enables clients to manage media types for content versioning and stability. Pagination is implemented through 'limit' and 'lastId' parameters, with 'next' links included in the response header for navigating through results.

description: The Zuora Billing REST API offers a comprehensive set of operations and resources for managing billing processes.
tldr: The Zuora Billing REST API provides a comprehensive set of operations and resources for managing billing processes. It supports web storefront integration, self-service subscriber sign-ups, and account management. The API also facilitates the processing of revenue schedules and allows manipulation of most objects within the Zuora Billing Object Model, enabling robust control over billing functionalities.

description: The Musixmatch API offers a robust service for searching and retrieving millions of licensed lyrics for integration into websites or applications.
tldr: The Musixmatch API provides a comprehensive service for accessing and integrating a vast library of licensed lyrics. It allows developers to search for and retrieve lyrics, ensuring legal compliance and protection from liability through adherence to its terms and conditions. The API also supports matching user catalogs with Musixmatch's extensive database and retrieving lyrics using specific API calls, making it a powerful tool for lyric-centric applications.

description: The Orthanc API provides comprehensive documentation for the REST API of Orthanc, a free and open-source DICOM server.
tldr: The Orthanc API offers complete documentation for its REST API, which is used by the free and open-source DICOM server. This reference is automatically generated from Orthanc's source code, guaranteeing its currency and accuracy. While a concise cheat sheet is available in the Orthanc Book, this full documentation provides developers with all necessary details for integration and use.

description: The GeoDB Cities API offers comprehensive global city and region data, enabling easy retrieval for applications.
tldr: The GeoDB Cities API provides extensive global city and region data, allowing users to effortlessly integrate this information into their applications. It supports filtering cities by various criteria including name prefix, country, location, time-zone, and minimum population. Additionally, the API offers sorting capabilities by name, country code, elevation, and population. This RESTful API includes HATEOAS-style links for pagination and is built on a resilient, cloud-based infrastructure, with data regularly updated from GeoNames and WikiData.

description: Browserless.io provides an enterprise-grade, enhanced version of the open-source Browserless image for large-scale automation.
tldr: Browserless.io offers a powerful, enterprise-grade solution built upon the open-source Browserless image, specifically tailored for extensive automation needs. It features a Chrome-devtools-protocol based API, enabling seamless integration with various programming languages through library extensions. The platform includes a hybrid-automation toolkit that allows for live session interactivity, alongside robust session management capabilities. Additionally, it supports advanced functionalities such as multiplexing clients, custom extensions, and multi-browser compatibility, making it a comprehensive tool for complex automation tasks.

description: The bunq API is a RESTful API using JSON for responses, enabling integration with bunq's financial services.
tldr: The bunq API is a RESTful interface that primarily uses JSON for all its responses, including error messages. It provides developers with the tools to integrate their applications with bunq's financial services. Key functionalities include the creation of API keys, registration of devices, and comprehensive session management. The API is actively maintained and updated, with continuous improvements being rolled out, and users are advised to subscribe to the newsletter for updates.

description: The Netatmo API provides access to data from Netatmo smart home devices, including weather stations, smart thermostats, and security cameras.
tldr: The Netatmo API allows developers to integrate Netatmo smart home products into their own applications. It provides access to data from various devices like weather stations, smart thermostats, and security cameras. Developers can retrieve data and control these devices, enabling a wide range of custom smart home solutions. The API uses OAuth2 for secure authentication, protecting user data.

description: The PDF Generator API creates transactional PDF documents, reducing development and support costs with a drag-and-drop editor.
tldr: The PDF Generator API facilitates the creation of transactional PDF documents, aiming to reduce development and support costs. It achieves this through a browser-based drag-and-drop document editor for efficient template management. The API operates on a web API architecture, supporting JSON media type and UTF-8 encoding, which allows developers to integrate it using their preferred programming language. For secure authentication, it utilizes JSON Web Tokens (JWT), requiring a server-side generated token to be included as a Bearer Token in request headers.

description: Data2CRM.API facilitates data migration between diverse CRM platforms, offering comprehensive documentation and live testing.
tldr: Data2CRM.API is a service designed for migrating data across different CRM platforms. It provides extensive documentation and practical code samples to assist users in understanding and implementing its functionalities. The API supports testing in a live environment, allowing developers to explore its mechanisms and seamlessly integrate it into their existing systems. This ensures efficient and reliable data transfer solutions for various CRM needs.

description: PeerTube API is a RESTful interface for interacting with PeerTube instances, supporting OpenAPI Generator for SDKs.
tldr: The PeerTube API offers a RESTful interface over HTTP(S) for developers to interact with PeerTube instances using various programming languages and HTTP/REST libraries. It supports OpenAPI Generator for client SDK generation and provides pre-built SDKs for Python, Go, and Kotlin. Authentication is managed through access tokens, with accounts assigned roles such as Administrator, Moderator, and User, each possessing distinct permissions. The API utilizes standard HTTP status codes for responses and includes RFC7807-compliant error bodies for detailed error information.

description: The Apify API provides programmatic access to the Apify platform using RESTful HTTP endpoints and JSON.
tldr: The Apify API (version 2) offers programmatic access to the Apify platform through RESTful HTTP endpoints. It supports JSON format for all requests and responses, with exceptions detailed in the reference documentation. The API can be accessed using Node.js and Python via dedicated NPM and PyPI packages, which simplify development by mirroring API endpoints and parameters for ease of use.

description: The drchrono API offers a detailed reference for integrating with the drchrono platform using OAuth 2.0 authentication.
tldr: The drchrono API provides a comprehensive reference for developers to integrate their applications with the drchrono platform. It utilizes an OAuth 2.0 authentication workflow, which involves redirecting users to an authorization page, obtaining user authorization, and exchanging an authorization code for an access token. Developers can request specific scopes to precisely control the level of access their applications have to user data, ensuring secure and granular permissions.

description: Apacta is an API for craftsmen to manage working hours, material usage, and quality assurance with secure communication.
tldr: Apacta is an API tailored for craftsmen, enabling them to efficiently manage various aspects of their work, including tracking working hours, monitoring material usage, and ensuring quality assurance. The API prioritizes secure communication by utilizing SSL and authenticates users through API keys passed as URL query parameters. It also includes experimental features such as pagination, search and filter capabilities, data ordering, and associations, providing flexible options for data retrieval and manipulation.

description: Access real-time information for FIRST Robotics Competition events globally, including scores and rankings.
tldr: The FRC Events API delivers real-time data for FIRST Robotics Competition events worldwide. Information is directly sourced from the Field Management System (FMS) at each event. Data automatically syncs to the cloud when internet connectivity is established, ensuring timely updates on event details, scores, and team rankings. This system guarantees that event information is current and accessible, even after temporary internet outages.

description: Integrate Clockify with other tools, automate time tracking, generate custom reports, and build custom add-ons.
tldr: The Clockify API enables integration with external tools, automation of time tracking, and creation of custom reports and add-ons. It uses API keys or Addon tokens for authentication in the request header. Webhooks provide real-time notifications for events like timer starts or time entry deletions, with limits of 10 per admin and 100 per workspace. The API also enforces a rate limit of 50 requests per second for add-ons and supports pagination for GET endpoints returning lists of entities.

description: The CORE API v2 offers access to a vast collection of harvested and enriched research resources, including articles, journals, and repositories.
tldr: The CORE API v2 provides access to a vast collection of harvested and enriched research resources, including articles, journals, and repositories. It supports complex search queries using Elasticsearch syntax, allowing users to filter by various fields such as title, authors, and publication year. Responses are formatted in JSON, with options for single object, list, or batch request results, and include a totalHits field for search queries.

description: Manage your Jumpseller online store's data, including products, orders, and customers, through a programmatic interface.
tldr: The Jumpseller API offers programmatic access to manage your online store's data, encompassing products, orders, and customer information. Authentication is handled via a token-based system, requiring a login key and an authentication token, both accessible from your Admin Panel. All API URLs are version-prefixed and end with .json, indicating support for JSON data serialization. For POST and PUT requests, the API specifically requires the 'application/json' content type.

description: Manage webhooks with Apideck's API, supporting custom headers, cursor-based pagination, and a mock API for testing.
tldr: The Apideck Webhook API offers comprehensive endpoints for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting webhooks. It enables users to configure webhook functionalities, including the use of custom headers for consumer and application identification, which helps in securely managing data. The API also implements cursor-based pagination, ensuring efficient and scalable retrieval of large datasets. Additionally, a mock API is provided to facilitate robust development and integration testing, allowing developers to simulate API responses without actual data.

description: The GraphHopper Directions API offers RESTful web services for integrating advanced route planning and optimization into applications.
tldr: The GraphHopper Directions API provides a comprehensive suite of RESTful web services designed for integrating advanced route planning and optimization features into various applications. It encompasses a wide range of functionalities, including routing, route optimization, isochrone calculations, map matching, matrix calculations, geocoding, and clustering. Developers can leverage these services to implement essential location-based functionalities such as A-to-B navigation and turn-by-turn directions, enhancing their applications with robust mapping and logistics capabilities.

description: The Adafruit IO HTTP API provides access to your Adafruit IO data from any programming language or hardware environment that can speak HTTP.
tldr: The Adafruit IO HTTP API allows users to interact with their Internet of Things projects by retrieving and sending data. It provides access to Adafruit IO data from any programming language or hardware environment that can speak HTTP. Authentication for every API request is handled via an API key, which can be provided in the header or as a query parameter. This API is designed for seamless integration with various applications and devices.

description: The Climate FieldView Platform APIs provide access to agricultural data and services, with all endpoints secured via HTTPS.
tldr: The Climate FieldView Platform APIs offer access to agricultural data and services, with all endpoints secured via HTTPS for data integrity and privacy. Users are assigned custom usage plans that define throttling and quota limits, ensuring fair access and preventing abuse of the system. Pagination is handled through headers, allowing efficient retrieval of large datasets, and chunked uploads support large file transfers, making it suitable for extensive agricultural data management.

description: The eBay Deal API allows select developers to search for and retrieve detailed information about eBay deals and events.
tldr: The eBay Deal API is a limited release API designed for select developers. It enables third-party developers to search for and retrieve detailed information about eBay deals and events. Additionally, it provides access to data concerning the specific items associated with these deals and events, offering a comprehensive view of promotional offerings on the eBay platform.

description: PandaScore REST API offers comprehensive eSports data for various videogames, including leagues, tournaments, and matches.
tldr: The PandaScore REST API provides extensive data on eSports events, covering leagues, series, tournaments, and individual matches across a wide range of videogames. It is designed for developers to build integrations and access detailed competitive gaming information. All data is exchanged in JSON format, and timestamps are consistently provided in ISO-8601 format for easy parsing and synchronization.

description: The NBG Account and Transaction API Specification allows AISPs to access account and transaction data.
tldr: The NBG Account and Transaction API Specification, based on UK Open Banking Specification v3.1.5, enables Account Information Service Providers (AISPs) to access account and transaction data. It supports creating consent, retrieving account details, balances, transactions, beneficiaries, standing orders, parties, scheduled payments, and statements. The API provides both sandbox and production environments for development and live data access.

description: Integrate cryptocurrency swap functionalities into web applications, supporting over 1500 crypto assets with flexible rates.
tldr: The StealthEX API facilitates the integration of cryptocurrency swap features directly into web applications. It supports a wide range of over 1500 crypto assets, offering both flexible floating and fixed exchange rates. Developers can customize fee settings and integrate with various crypto services, including wallets and aggregators. Authentication is handled using API keys, with bearer authentication in headers being the preferred method, and a rate limit of 600 requests per minute is enforced.

description: The Fulfillment.com APIv2 offers a RESTful interface for managing order fulfillment processes.
tldr: The Fulfillment.com APIv2 provides a RESTful interface for managing order fulfillment processes. It uses OAuth 2.0 for authentication, supporting both implicit and password grant types. The API is version-controlled and backwards compatible, ensuring new data nodes may be added without removing existing API knowledge. It reports date-time stamps using the ISO 8601 standard and tracks three fundamental milestones in the order fulfillment process.

description: The VTEX Catalog API manages product and SKU catalog data, including categories, brands, and related information.
tldr: The VTEX Catalog API offers comprehensive methods for managing product and SKU catalog data. It enables developers to consult, create, and update products, SKUs, and their various attributes, such as specifications, attachments, files, and services. This API is specifically designed to streamline the onboarding experience for developers who need to integrate with VTEX's catalog functionalities, providing a robust interface for data manipulation.

description: Kajabi's beta API offers developers access to manage contacts, sites, and user information.
tldr: Kajabi's API, currently in beta, allows developers to interact with and manage various aspects of their Kajabi accounts. It provides functionalities for handling contacts, managing sites, and accessing user information. The API supports the use of custom API keys, which can be created, deleted, or rotated to ensure secure access. Future updates are planned to enhance filtering and sorting capabilities across its endpoints.

description: Tisane is a natural language processing library offering standard NLP, problematic content detection, and low-level NLP.
tldr: Tisane is a comprehensive natural language processing library providing standard NLP functionality, specialized tools for detecting problematic or abusive content, and low-level NLP capabilities such as morphological analysis and tokenization for languages without spaces. Its monolithic architecture centralizes all functions through a single POST /parse method, ensuring consistent language models and analysis processes. Other API methods primarily serve as wrappers, helpers, or tools for inspecting the underlying language models.

description: The Fitbit Plus API is a RESTful API using JSON API specification, supporting OAuth 2.0 for authentication.
tldr: The Fitbit Plus API is a RESTful API that adheres to the JSON API specification for both requests and responses. It utilizes OAuth 2.0 for authentication, supporting client credentials and refresh tokens. This authentication method is primarily intended for background operations such as reporting, analysis, and data synchronization with external systems like Electronic Medical Records (EMRs). The API provides flexibility in data retrieval by offering both skip-based and cursor-based pagination strategies for its GET collection endpoints.

description: Manage Combell resources programmatically using standard HTTP requests and JSON for data exchange.
tldr: The Combell Public API allows resellers to programmatically manage their resources. It supports standard HTTP methods such as GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE for resource manipulation. The API exclusively uses JSON for data exchange, with snake casing for resources and query parameters. Datetimes are formatted according to ISO-8601 standards.

description: The BikeWise API v2 offers a comprehensive database of bicycling incidents, including locations, types, and statuses.
tldr: The BikeWise API v2 provides access to a detailed database of bicycling-related incidents. Developers can retrieve information such as incident locations, types, and their current reported statuses. This API is specifically designed to support applications focused on enhancing cyclist safety and awareness by delivering timely and relevant data about various incidents.

description: Integrate ContentGroove's video AI capabilities into custom applications and workflows using direct API calls and webhooks.
tldr: The ContentGroove Developer API enables seamless integration of ContentGroove's video AI features into various applications and workflows. It offers two primary interaction methods: direct API calls for immediate data retrieval and webhooks for real-time event notifications. Webhooks are particularly useful for receiving video-related information, such as suggested clips and transcriptions, which can then be used to update systems or initiate specific business processes automatically.

description: The Braze API offers a high-performance REST API for user tracking, message sending, and data export.
tldr: The Braze API provides a robust RESTful interface for managing user data, dispatching messages, and extracting information. It leverages HTTPS for secure programmatic data transfer. The API includes diverse endpoints tailored for specific actions and data retrieval, with distinct instances available for both US and EU database regions to accommodate regional data residency requirements.

description: The Apache Airflow API offers REST endpoints for managing Airflow objects, supporting CRUD operations on resources.
tldr: The Apache Airflow API provides a comprehensive set of REST endpoints for managing Airflow objects, enabling operations like creating, reading, updating, and deleting resources. It supports standard CRUD operations on most resources, maintaining consistent naming conventions for resources and parameters. The API design prioritizes clear resource identification and structured request/response bodies for efficient interaction and management of Airflow workflows and components.

description: The Alerter System API provides a robust interface for managing alerts and notifications within applications.
tldr: The Alerter System API offers a comprehensive interface for integrating alert and notification functionalities into various applications. It enables developers to ensure timely communication of critical events to users or systems. While a playground is available for testing and development, the full API supports multiple authorization methods, making it suitable for secure and scalable production environments.

description: The ClickSend REST API v3 offers a comprehensive set of methods for interacting with ClickSend.com services.
tldr: The ClickSend REST API v3 provides a comprehensive set of methods for interacting with ClickSend.com services. It supports various operations including selecting, creating, updating, and deleting items, with responses indicated by standard HTTP status codes. Users need to create a free account and authenticate using Basic HTTP authentication with their API username and key or account username and password.

description: Search and query the OpenSanctions entity graph for people, companies, and other entities, including sanctions lists.
tldr: The OpenSanctions API enables users to search and query a comprehensive entity graph. This includes individuals, companies, and various other entities. It can be utilized to verify the presence of specific entities on sanctions lists or within the extensive OpenSanctions dataset. The API provides functionalities for entity matching, including fuzzy name matching, text-based search, and retrieving complete entity details along with their related entities.

description: The SIGNL4 API enables system integration and custom use case development, supporting two-way integration.
tldr: The SIGNL4 API facilitates system integration and custom use case development. It supports two-way integration for triggering signals and updating third-party systems based on alert state changes. The API also allows for retrieving alarms for logging and managing calendar integrations, including on-call duties and user punch-ins/outs. Authentication requires an API key generated in the SIGNL4 portal, which must be included in the 'X-S4-Api-Key' header for all HTTP requests.

description: EnsembleData provides real-time, publicly available social media data without restrictions, processing millions of daily requests.
tldr: EnsembleData, established in 2020, offers real-time access to publicly available social media data. Their platform is designed to handle millions of daily requests and scales infrastructure dynamically, ensuring no rate limits are imposed on users. The cost for each API request is calculated based on its complexity and the parameters used, utilizing a 'units' currency system.

description: The OpenFEC API provides programmatic access to Federal Election Commission (FEC) campaign finance data.
tldr: The OpenFEC API offers programmatic access to Federal Election Commission (FEC) campaign finance data. It enables users to investigate how candidates and committees finance their campaigns using RESTful web services, supporting both full-text and field-specific searches. The data is updated nightly, and users can register for an API key to perform up to 1,000 calls per hour, with each call restricted to 100 results per page.

description: Integrate Zapier's platform capabilities into your products, accessing over 5,000 apps and 50,000 actions.
tldr: The Zapier Natural Language Actions (NLA) API enables developers to embed Zapier's extensive platform functionalities directly into their applications. It offers a unified natural language interface to interact with more than 5,000 apps and execute over 50,000 distinct actions. This API streamlines common integration challenges, such as authentication, and supports a wide range of operations including creating, updating, and searching, all optimized for natural language input.

description: The Budgea API offers a RESTful interface for financial data access, primarily for agents under DSP2 regulations.
tldr: The Budgea API provides a RESTful interface for accessing financial data, specifically designed for agents operating under DSP2 regulations. It ensures secure communication via HTTPS and uses JSON for data exchange. Users can retrieve bank information, manage authentication tokens, and customize API parameters to meet their specific requirements.

description: The Envoice.in API provides programmatic access to manage invoice activities and integrate with external systems.
tldr: The Envoice.in API offers programmatic access for managing invoice activities and integrating with external systems. It supports webhooks, enabling real-time updates and synchronization of invoice data. Users can configure up to 10 webhook URLs to receive HTTP POST payloads when specific events are triggered, facilitating seamless data flow and automation.

description: Geneea's NLP API provides text analysis operations like lemmatization, sentiment analysis, and named entity recognition.
tldr: The Geneea Natural Language Processing API offers a suite of text analysis functionalities, including lemmatization, text correction, topic detection, sentiment analysis, and named entity recognition. It supports processing raw text or content extracted from URLs, allowing users to specify the language and choose appropriate text extractors. The API expects UTF-8 encoded input and delivers results in a structured JSON format, with HTTP status codes indicating any errors encountered during processing.

description: The Hetzner Cloud API offers a RESTful interface for managing cloud resources, using HTTPS and JSON for data exchange.
tldr: The Hetzner Cloud API provides a RESTful interface for managing cloud resources, operating over HTTPS and using JSON for data exchange. It leverages standard HTTP methods and status codes for requests and responses, ensuring a familiar interaction model for developers. Users can interact with the API directly or through official CLI programs and libraries for Go and Python, offering flexibility in integration. Additionally, open-source integrations may be eligible for credit, encouraging community contributions and broader adoption.

description: The Color Me Shop App Store API allows developers to create apps that integrate with Color Me Shop.
tldr: The Color Me Shop App Store API enables developers to build applications that seamlessly integrate with the Color Me Shop platform. It provides functionalities for managing billing data, including in-app purchases and metered billing, and allows for the handling of both inline and regular script tags within shop pages. Access to the API requires OAuth authentication, and various scopes are available to control permissions for different features.

description: The Loket.nl API is a RESTful API providing access to data and features of the Loket.nl platform.
tldr: The Loket.nl API is a RESTful interface that allows programmatic access to the data and functionalities available within the Loket.nl platform. It exclusively uses JSON for both request and response bodies, ensuring a standardized data exchange format. Access to this API is strictly limited to registered users, maintaining data security and integrity. This documentation specifically covers version 2 of the API, offering comprehensive resources for partners and existing users to facilitate seamless integration and efficient API call execution.

description: Access media content from the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services with advanced sorting capabilities.
tldr: The HHS Media Services API provides access to media content from the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. It supports advanced sorting capabilities, allowing users to sort results by multiple columns, specify ascending or descending order, and combine sorting criteria. Date inputs are expected to conform to the RFC 3339 standard for consistent data handling across all requests.
